Recap: Spencer tells Blair that he really did love her the whole time and that she was the one who lied to him. Todd suddenly appears spewing how love means never having to say that you are sorry. "Drop dead!" Todd reminds the good doctor that he was dead once and that he was the healer who brought him back to life. Spencer knows that he has been made out to be the bad guy in all this but he knows that Todd is worse and that is why it was so easy for him to steal Blair away from him. John is holding on the wheel, trying to steer the car to safety. Suddenly, he is at the graveyard, standing over his father's grave. His father appears, knowing that John has caught the killer. John seems troubled and his father wonders if finally, after having spent most of his adult life chasing this killer, if John is finally at peace. He isn't sure. John feels something was missing. He wanted to be there for his father. He remembers the night at the ER. His father was pointing. John thought that it was he, his father was pointing at, but it was actually Truman who was part of the team there to save Thomas. David was there as well and he was panicky staring at the scene of Thomas slowly dying. "Get that kid out of there!" Spencer grabbed his brother and ordered him to go home! Natalie is home and she smiles as she thinks about the past and memories of she and John in the beginning. She remembers telling him how he treats her like no one else. Cristian is in trouble. The public believes that he took a dive. The replay the part of the fight where he falls and Abbot's glove doesn't even make contact with Cristian's face. Cristian tells the press that there was something on Abbot's glove but everyone just laughs at his desperate attempt to save himself. The commission is investigating and will be making a decision on all that has gone on, but after that, Cristian vows to figure out what happen. John has his memories and even thinks sees the kids that he could have one day with Natalie. His father tells that this is the way that it should be. "You are going to propose aren't you?" A car horn is heard in the distance and John has to go. He gets up and walks out of the graveyard. He is back in his care in an instant, still trying to guide it to safety. His life flashes before him, each a snapshot of a special time then CRASH! Everything is broken and nothing moves.
Transcript: Natalie: Think, Natalie, think. Ok, accident scene, procedural protocol.
John: What -- [Horn honks, tires screech]
[SCENE_BREAK]
Evangeline: Don't -- don't, Cris. Don't use that.
Cristian: My hand is fine.
Evangeline: No, no, it's not. It should be in a cast.
Cristian: I -- it's fine, I'm telling you. I know my body, and it was fine before the fight, it'll be fine before the next one.
Vincent: That's if you have a next one. The boxing commission just might yank your license.
Cristian: They can't do that.
Vincent: Let's just wait till they review the tape. If they think you threw the fight, they might even file charges.
Cristian: I didn't take a fall. I wouldn't take a fall.
Vincent: You know, we'll get you up to that podium and you tell the press exactly that.
Cristian: It doesn't make any sense. Nobody had anything to gain by me losing, right?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Spencer: Well? Did you ever have any feelings for me, Blair? Or was it all just a setup right from the beginning? I think I deserve an answer.
Blair: You're getting exactly what you deserve, Spencer.

Spencer: Because I sure thought what we had was real. I sure did. I guess I should've known better, huh? The thing is, I didn't lie about loving you, and I would do everything that I did all over again. I am not sorry for what I did in order to be with you, you understand?
Todd: That's so sweet, Spencer. Because, you know, love means never having to say you're sorry. Isn't that right, Blair?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Thomas: I was beginning to wonder if you were going to make it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Blair: What are you doing here, Todd?
Todd: Oh, you know, I just feel indebted to Spencer because he saved my life and -- so I want to know if there's anything I can do to help you out.
Spencer: You could drop dead.
Todd: I already did -- then you brought me back.
Blair: Ok, you know what? The game is over, Spencer.

Spencer: It's never been a game to me, Blair. Never been a game -- that's the difference between me and psycho boy here. You see, I still care about you. No matter what you did to me, I will always care about you.
Blair: Oh, I think you need to look a little closer into my eyes here and you'll see that I don't care about you. In fact, I despise you.
Spencer: What I see when I look in your eyes is fear. You know he's going to make your life miserable.
Todd: You got to give him credit. He just doesn't give up. Even at the end here, he still thinks I'm the bad guy.
Spencer: You are the bad guy, Todd, and Blair knows it. That's why it was so easy to turn her against you in the first place.
Todd: Hmm.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Man: Excuse me, coming through.
Evangeline: Hey, you didn't do anything wrong. You just go in there and you let them know that. Ok?
Vincent: That's not what those wolves are saying.
Cristian: I didn't take a dive, but how do I say that I was drugged?
Layla: Can we prove it somehow?
Cristian: Well, we tried to get the commission to check Abbott's gloves.
Evangeline: Well, if they find something, doesn't it mean that you're vindicated and Abbott is disqualified?
Vincent: If Abbott had something on his gloves, he probably got rid of them by now.
Evangeline: Well, then why didn't you have someone hold the gloves for evidence?
Vincent: Moi? I didn't know any of this was going down. I'm sorry, doll, but my crystal ball is at the shop this week.
Cristian: All right, listen, thanks for looking out, but this wasn't a crime scene.
Evangeline: And yet, if they find something on his gloves, it was.

Vincent: Would you shut it down? Cristian was out cold. Abbott is running around the ring all jacked up. People were going in and out. I'm standing there stunned. Oh, I get it -- I'm supposed to be, like, "hold everything, let's smell the gloves." Come on, let's get this show started.
Boy: Hey, Cris? He is Fernando, I'm Steven -- remember us from Angel Square?
Cristian: Yeah, of course. What's up, guys?
Fernando: Yeah, what happened, man? You're the best.
Steven: You could beat anyone.
Fernando: We know you'd never take a dive, man.
Steven: You wouldn't, would you?
[SCENE_BREAK]
John: How'd you know I was coming?
Thomas: You promised you'd come and tell me when it was all over. It is, isn't it?
John: Yeah, it's over.
Thomas: You got the guy who killed me?
John: I got him finally, and he's going to pay.
Thomas: What about you?
John: I think I'm done paying. I think now I just want to get some peace.
Thomas: You really mean that?
John: I figure I spent the better part of my adult life trying to find the man who shot you. I got to close that book, dad.
Thomas: I'm glad. Vengeance consumed you, didn't it?
John: That, it did.
Thomas: Ate up any chance you had to be happy?
John: I've always been a miserable son of a bitch, but maybe now -- maybe now it's over.
Thomas: Are you happy now, Johnny?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reporter: Cris --
Vincent: Excuse us. Excuse us. Excuse us!
Reporter: Do you think the boxing commission will suspend your license?
Cristian: All right, all right, time-out, time-out.

Vincent: Ok. Thank you all for coming. My name is Vincent Jones, and I'm Cristian Vega's manager. Now, I know there's a lot of controversy and alleged cheating allegations surrounding last night's fight, and we'd like to clear it up. So I thought it'd be best to have Mr. Vega come up here himself to tell you exactly what happened, and he can answer any questions that you might have.
Cristian: I'll answer all your questions the best I can, but first I'd like to say something.
Ted: I had to twist an arm, but I got that present you were waiting for.
Vincent: Thanks.
Layla: What present?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Thomas: If you feel like it's over, you should allow yourself to be happy.
John: I guess it all depends on what your definition of happiness is.
Thomas: It's a state of mind, son.
John: Whatever you call it, it feels pretty damn good -- better than a shot of single malt on a cold day.
Thomas: Feels good for me, too, knowing that after all these years, you finally caught the man who shot me.
John: I should've caught him sooner.
Thomas: For yourself?
John: For you.
Thomas: You felt responsible, didn't you, for my death?

John: Somehow I always felt like I could've kept it from happening, like I missed something that day. You know, I wanted to be there for you in the E.R. -- to comfort you, to be there for you. But it seemed like the more I said, the more upset you got, and I never knew why.
Doctor: Move it, people, let's go!
John: You were pointing at someone else.
Spencer: Nurse, get that kid out of here, please.
Young John: Daddy -- let go! That's my dad!
Spencer: Nurse, get that kid out of here, please!
Young John: Daddy! Dad!
John: You weren't even pointing at me. You were pointing at Truman. He was standing right behind me. If I just would've turned around, I would've understood what you were trying to tell me.
Thomas: No. No. There was no way you could've understood. Not then, Johnny, but you do now. And you got him, and that's what matters.
John: Yeah, we have him, dad. You're right. That's all that matters. - How do you spark creativity?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Layla: So, what's in the envelope that you couldn't wait to get your hands on?
Vincent: It's our percent of the gate. Vega may not have won, but we still get paid. It's not the prize we were hoping for, but it's something.
Reporter: Hold it down! Check out the monitor. Abbott's punch never connected.
Reporter: All right, who told you to take the fall?
Cristian: No one told me to take a fall! I don't take falls -- never have, never will!
Reporter: So then tell us exactly what happened last night. [Reporters shout]
Evangeline: Ok.
Spencer: I suppose I should really thank you, Manning, for being such a bad guy because, otherwise, Blair would've never known what it's like to be loved by a real man.
Blair: He's just trying to tick you off, Todd.
Todd: Well, he does have a point. I'm not exactly a model citizen.
Spencer: Never will be.
Todd: But you know, though, Blair's no angel, either. That's why you're attracted to her.
Blair: I have a very rich history with Todd. It's full of scandal, and that's why I think half the people in this town think that we deserve each other because we're both so screwed up.
Todd: What half is that?
Blair: Hmm.
Spencer: Thank you for that little insight into what your life together has been like. I can hardly wait to get out of here to see how things have progressed.
Todd: It's not going to happen, is it?
Spencer: These charges, the murder charge -- everything will be dropped, manning.
Todd: Hmm, it's a pretty long list, though, Spencer. And I'm certain there are lots of other crimes --
Spencer: Circumstantial evidence.
Blair: "Circumstantial" like the gun that killed John Mc Bain's father?

Spencer: Even if they could prove that it was my gun, they cannot put it in my hand all those years ago. But I'm not going to discuss the fine points of my defense with you people. What I do want to talk about is the party we're going to have when I get out of here.

Todd: But you know you're never going to get out of here, right? You're going to die -- you see that? Look, look, look. You see it in his face, he's just terrified. It's great. I tell you, though, if you do manage to weasel yourself out of here, I'm going to be waiting on the outside. I'm going to kill you myself.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Natalie: Whew. Um -- Cristian said you were looking for me?
John: You're Natalie?
Natalie: Yeah. Why?
John: Well, if I didn't have a reason before, I got one now.

Natalie: Thank you for letting me be mad. I mean, I know -- I know it sounds kind of weird, but you're the only one who will just let me get it all out. Everybody else wants me to be a hero or a widow or a basket case, and you just accept me for whatever comes out.
John: It's no big deal.
Natalie: It is.
John: Truman. I should've figured it out.
Thomas: You were a child.
John: Of course he was at the hospital that night.
Thomas: He was.
John: And Vickers was there, too, wasn't he?
Thomas: That kid couldn't have hit the broadside of a barn with a cannon. He was shaking like a leaf.
John: He thought he'd shot a cop.
Thomas: And you think Spencer was there to comfort him?
Young John: Let go of me. That's my dad!
Nurse: BP's dropping. We have to do something, fast.
Young John: Let me go!
Spencer: Pull it together.
Young David: Did you hear what that nurse just said? His dad -- I killed that cop.
Spencer: You know what that means? That makes you a murderer, you understand? Now, you know what you have to do?
Young David: I don't know.
Spencer: You got to get the hell out of here, all right? Just go, run, leave, now!
John: That son of a bitch was going to let his own brother hang for a murder he didn't commit.
Thomas: Yep. He isn't a good man now and he wasn't then.
John: Makes you realize nothing's more important than family.
Thomas: No, there isn't.
John: You have a grandson, you know?
Thomas: Do I?
John: Yeah. Michael and Marcie, they're adopting a little boy. They call him Thomas.
Thomas: Ha. That's wonderful.
John: Hey, you remember that Atlantic City P.D. cap you bought me for Christmas?
Thomas: Yeah. I never got a chance to give it to you, did I?
John: No, but Pete took care of that.
Thomas: Hmm.
John: And I gave it to Thomas.
Thomas: You didn't want to save it for your own son?
John: Well, I don't know about me settling down. And if I did, I'm not too sure I'd want my kid being a cop.
Thomas: Why not? It's an honorable profession -- that is, if you're in it for the right reasons.
John: Yeah. Well, I know I'm staying on the job. It's funny -- I always wanted to be like you, dad, I never wanted to be anything else.
Thomas: Yeah, it's a lonely job, not to mention dangerous.

John: It's the only thing I'm good at. I never told you this, but I thought about quitting once. Yeah. I even wrote down the name of that -- that driving school -- you know, I thought about maybe driving a big rig across the country and stuff -- but, hell, that's not for me. I just can't let the job consume me the way it has.

Thomas: Mm-hmm. Sometimes we're driven by our demons, and we make foolish choices -- like going into that alley blind without a backup. If I hadn't gone in there, I would've come home to my family -- to you, to Michael, to your mother.
John: We've all made our share of mistakes.
Man: Take a step, and the doc here is dead.
John: You picked the wrong day to screw with the LPD.
Man: What do you want to do, negotiate?
John: Yeah -- like this.
Man: I mean it, I'll shoot!
John: Drop it.
Man: Stop first.
John: Drop it or I drop you.
Todd: What are you doing? We're going down!
John: If we do, we go down together.
Todd: We're going to die handcuffed together?
John: It looks that way.
Todd: Now, what do I do?
John: I suggest you pray.
John: We got to move!
John: I know I've had my demons, but I hope that's the last of them. I need them to be gone.
Thomas: I hope so. What now, Johnny?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reporter: Then why was he in prison?
Cristian: Hold on, wait a minute, that's not the issue here! That's not the issue!
Reporter: Oh.
Cristian: I did not throw that fight! Now, I don't know what went down last night, but I'm going to find out, and when I do, whoever did this is going to pay!
Reporter: Oh, right.
Second reporter: Yeah, come on.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Thomas: Have you thought about what's next?
John: Making up for lost time. I don't know -- actually I thought about maybe starting a family of my own. But I don't know. I probably wouldn't make a very good father.
Thomas: Why is that?
John: A lot of people tell me that I'm closed off and I'm moody and short- tempered.
Thomas: Sounds like you take after your old man.
John: Maybe I do.
Thomas: Being dead hasn't erased my shortcomings. It's just given you time to forget them.
John: Let's leave it that way.
Thomas: So, is there anyone?
John: Natalie.
Thomas: Well, the way say her name, it sounds like you care for her very much.
John: She just has one flaw.
Thomas: What's that?
John: She has feelings for me.
Thomas: Why is that a flaw?
John: Beyond the obvious, I've treated her like crap.
Natalie: What am I supposed to do, John? Just lock myself up in my house, wait till the killer gets caught?
John: Yeah, yeah, that's exactly what you're supposed to do, Natalie.
Natalie: All right, I won't -- um -- do any more favors for you again.
John: God! You know why? Because I don't want it. The last thing I need is for someone I love to get killed again!
Thomas: So?
John: "So" what? So that's it. I mean, she -- she can be a pain in the ass, and -- and I'm a real jerk.
Thomas: Come on, now, Johnny. Give me the details. I've got nothing but time.
John: Yeah, there's more. Stay with me, Natalie. Stay with me! I'm still here.
Natalie: So am I. It's St. Jude.
John: Now, how'd you know about St. Jude?
Natalie: They say that St. Jude's supposed to look after cops.
John: Actually, St. Michael's the patron saint of policemen. St. Jude is for lost causes.
Natalie: Really?
John: He's supposed to make the impossible possible.
Natalie: Big job. Merry Christmas, John. What is all this?
John: I don't know. What does it look like?
Natalie: You set it up, you tell me.
John: Well, I just thought maybe you'd want to spend the night with me.
Natalie: Do you have the key in there?
John: Let's see what happens.
Natalie: I'm sorry. [Natalie sighs] I promised myself that if I ever got out of that pit, I would stop doing things like that.
John: Fine, because I promised myself that if you made it, I'd start doing some things differently, too.
Thomas: Sounds like love to me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reporter: Right here. One question. Over here. Do you have any proof you were set up?
Cristian: Not yet.
Reporter: Come on! [Reporters react]
Evangeline: Vincent!

Vincent: Good job. Listen, listen, thank you all. It's been a very long 24 hours, and Mr. Vega's understandably exhausted. So we'll get back to you as soon as we have any news or as soon as the boxing commission comes to a final decision. Thank you very much. Have a good night. Let's go champ.
[Reporters react and shout questions]
Vincent: You sure it's not going to come back to bite me?
Ted: Don't worry. They're not going to come up with nothing except maybe Cristian took a fall.
Vincent: I feel sorry for this guy, man.
Ted: But you don't feel sorry for your wallet.
Vincent: Kid had potential.
Ted: Not with that bum hand, he didn't. He wasn't going to end up anywhere but the clinic.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Spencer: Did you hear that, Blair? The man you profess to love just threatened to kill me. What a guy, huh? And you wonder why she left you, ran off to me, thinking that you were capable of killing Margaret and your very own son?
Todd: I find your B.S. boring.
Spencer: I didn't steal Blair away from you, Todd. You drove her away, man, yourself!
Blair: Todd -- just don't.
Spencer: You know, the thing is, is that you're never going to be able to forgive her, either. You're so full of venom, you know that? I'm not even convinced that you didn't kill your own son.
Todd: Where is he, Truman? Why don't you tell me where he is.
Blair: Why don't you be decent just one moment in your life and tell Todd where his son is?
Spencer: And what would be in it for me? Hmm? Nobody even told me I had a son.
Todd: Lucky for him. That's how come he turned out so decent.

Spencer: You know, manning, if your son never knows you, he just might stand a chance at being a decent human being, as well. But it doesn't matter because you're never going to find him -- even if he is still alive.
Todd: So help me, Truman, if you hurt him --
Spencer: Oh, trust me, I didn't harm one hair on his cute little bald head. Margaret, on the other hand -- I mean --
Blair: Ok, you know what? Stop it.
Spencer: She's capable of just about anything.
Blair: I don't even know why I came here.
Todd: Why did you come here?
Blair: Because I wanted Spencer to hear three little words -- rot in hell.
Spencer: You know, I don't know what I liked better -- watching her coming or going.
Todd: Oh, she's very pretty.
Spencer: All right, manning. Just me and you now. Why did you come here? You have something to say to me? Say it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Thomas: You're at peace with it all, aren't you?
John: Yeah, something like that.
Thomas: Then why haven't you made a commitment to your girl?
John: Maybe I'm going to.
Thomas: "Going to"?
John: Don't push me, all right? You know, I don't even know what she would say. I'm not exactly the easiest person in the world to get along with.
Thomas: Well, you'll never know until you ask. My hunch is she'll hang in there for the long haul. She's already stuck with you, and it sounds like she's seen you at your worst.
John: That's for sure.
Thomas: This is just what you need -- someone to love and talk to.
John: See, none of that stuff comes easy for me, dad.
Thomas: Which is why you need someone who will love you unconditionally.
John: She is always there.
Thomas: Yeah. Not afraid to take you down a notch when you're being a jerk.
John: Natalie's never shy about that.

Thomas: Neither was your mother. This is just what you need. Not just someone who will give you a home and a family, but someone who can give you a safe place to go when -- where your demons won't follow.
John: You know, I've spent so much time alone. I've never really stopped and thought about a future with somebody.
Natalie: Ok, honey --
Boy: Mom, let me take this shot.
Natalie: All right, well, just remember to hit the side of that red ball, ok?
Girl: That's cheating -- she can't touch!
John: She's right, those are the rules. Why don't you just --
Natalie: Ok, well, just -- just lift your bridge thumb a little bit, ok, and then remember to pull the cue straight back, all right, a little topspin, and don't forget to follow through.
Boy: Mom, if you'd stop talking, I could take the shot.
John: I agree.
Girl: Ha. Now it's our turn.
John: Now it's our turn. Here we go.
Girl: What do you think, daddy? Side pocket?
John: I think the side pocket looks really good. This would go in here.
Singer: Just a dream
Boy: Hey -- you said that was cheating.
Singer: Moon is shining
John: When did I say that?
Singer: Perfectly but my heart
John: You ready? One thing we have to do first.
Singer: Can I hold on tight
Girl: We win! I love you, daddy.
John: You won, sweetie. I love you, too. All right, shake hands with your brother, ok? Good game. All right, we got time for one more game. Let's rack 'em up quick and we get going, all right?
Natalie: What did you whisper in her ear?
John: I told her I liked her hair.
Thomas: That's the life you deserve, Johnny.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Evangeline: Vincent?
Vincent: Hmm?
Evangeline: Look, I don't appreciate your attitude earlier, but I have to thank you.
Vincent: For what?
Evangeline: For trading roles with Cristian -- you were fighting for him.

Vincent: Well, that's what a boxing manager has to do sometimes. But I don't know how easy it's going to be to change public opinion. Another day or two, and the "Phantom Punch" is going to be the most searched phrase on the internet.
Layla: Hmm.
Evangeline: Then we need to prove that there was something on Abbott's gloves.
Vincent: And if we can't?
Evangeline: We have to.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Spencer: Guard? You can escort Mr. Manning out of here now. He's quite finished.
[Phone rings]
Todd: Excuse me a second. Yeah?
Evangeline: Hey. I need to talk to you. Can you meet me in Angel Square?
Todd: Sure.
Evangeline: How soon can you get there?
Todd: I'm on my way now.
Evangeline: Thanks, Todd. I really need your help.

Todd: Ok. Oh, I'm sorry. We're going to have to finish our little chat a little later. We'll finish it for sure, though. I just want you to know that I'm really going to look forward to seeing you die. Hey, Spencer, do you think -- do you think that it's in poor taste to bring popcorn to an execution? No, I'll think about it. Have a good night.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Natalie: Oh, God. Nothing makes me feel more in control than pool, when I'm playing.
John: Well, you should see yourself moving around that table. It's -- it's something.
Natalie: Well, you're pretty slick yourself. You sure you didn't lose on purpose?
John: I'm not that nice of a guy, Natalie. What? You ran the table, you left me with nothing.
Natalie: Yes, I did.
John: Not that it's any of my business or anything, but you think maybe when I'm gone, you'll -- you may play a little?
Natalie: Before tonight, I would've said no. Maybe I will. Thank you for pestering me.
John: You got it.
Natalie: Uh -- doesn't the winner owe you a drink?
John: I got to get back. Put my stuff in a bag and -- they're expecting me in New Jersey in the morning.
Natalie: They must be pretty happy with you with the job you've done here, catching the music box killer.
John: Let's hope.
Natalie: Well, I mean, everyone says it's a solid case. A lot of women in Llanview are going to breathe easier because of you.
John: Yeah, maybe.
Natalie: And -- um -- I'll miss you.
John: Well, I'll tell you what -- um -- here's my number. Maybe you'll use it sometime.
Natalie: I will.
John: All right.
Natalie: John?
John: Yeah?
Natalie: Take care of yourself.
John: You, too.
Natalie: How about a game of poker?
John: Sure. You want a buck a hand or something, make it interesting?

Natalie: Have you ever played emotional-strip poker? It's fun, it is. See, the -- the loser of the hand has to tell the winner something they've never told them before, no holding back allowed. Don't mess with the champ, Lieutenant.
John: That's a good hand.
Natalie: Mm-hmm.
John: Two pair -- that's a very good hand. But I -- I think that one might be better.
Natalie: Hmm.
John: So, by your own rules, you need to tell me something that you've never told me before. How'd you say it -- "no holding back"?
Natalie: I never stopped loving you.

John: Uh -- you all want to know what's going on with me and Natalie? Well, this is what's going on with me and Natalie. There. Now, you all got it out of your systems? Good. Recess is over. Now get back to work.
Natalie: Hurry home, John.
John: You know, you used to say to me -- you used to say "stop daydreaming, get back to reality." The truth is sometimes reality bites hard.
Thomas: And sometimes we can't prevent bad things from happening.
John: What's your point?
Thomas: Don't "what if" yourself into a safe little corner, Johnny. I'm proud of you, son, and you deserve true peace and happiness. Where do you think that comes from?
John: I guess it -- I guess it comes from love. Hey, where'd you learn to shoot like that?
Boy: Mom, obviously.
John: Hey -- not funny.
Boy: This is it. This is for the championship.
John: Ok.
Singer: Can I hold on tight to the memory
Boy: Sorry, Dad.
John: No worries. You did great. All right, two little hustlers, let's get you home. It's getting late, all right? Time for bed. Did we have fun?
Boy: Yep.
John: We did?
Boy: Yep.
John: All right. Who brought their money? All right, I'm paying. Let's get out of here.
Boy: I'm broke.
[Natalie and John laugh]
Thomas: It's the little things that we remember. So what's going on behind those blue eyes of yours? I'll be damned. You're going to ask that girl to marry you, aren't you?
John: I got to go, dad. What --
